ACT
93.  
Revocation of reciprocal will of spouses
A disposition in a reciprocal will of spouses specified in subsection 2 of § 89 of this Act may be revoked during the lifetime of both spouses unilaterally by either spouse. A will whereby the disposition specified in the first sentence is revoked shall be notarially authenticated. A disposition shall be deemed to be revoked when the other spouse receives a notice forwarded by the notarial procedure concerning revocation of the disposition.
The other spouse may revoke the disposition specified in subsection 2 of § 89 of this Act after the death of his or her spouse only if he or she renounces the succession which was given to him or her on basis of the will.
If spouses have nominated a person in the reciprocal will to whom the estate of the surviving spouse or other proceeds received on the basis of the reciprocal will transfers and that person has committed a criminal offence against the bequeather, the bequeather’s spouse, ascendant or descendant or has intentionally and materially violated the obligation thereof arising from law to maintain the bequeather, the surviving spouse may revoke his or her disposition also after acceptance of the proceeds received on the basis of the reciprocal will.
